medical_history.chief_complaint: Sharp abdominal pain in the right lower quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 23 hours ago with sharp pressure located in the right lower quadrant. The pain is continuous and non-radiating. The patient experienced anorexia but forced himself to eat, followed by vomiting 30 minutes later. There have been no symptoms of persistent nausea, changes in bowel movements, fever, chills, dysuria, hematuria, chest pain, shortness of breath, rashes, or joint pain.
medical_history.family_history: Mother has hypertension; Father has hypertension.
